Reviews.Title: “Nicer than many reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: Amanda1127
Reviews.Content: Allow me to preface this by observing that many of the reviewers on this page should have perhaps stayed at a fancier hotel and were expecting too much from somewhere as reasonably priced as Huttons. I stayed at this hotel with my mom from February 29 until March 5 and we were both pleasantly surprised. The staff member at the desk was very friendly and helpful and had us up in our room within minutes. While it was small, there was more than enough space to accommodate two single beds, a table between the beds and both of our suitcases with no difficulty. We never had to squeeze past one another or tripped over anything. The beds were somewhat hard, which is more to my mom's taste. I simply put the spare blanket under the bottom sheet of my bed for cushioning and it was perfect. The linens were changed daily and the room was kept very clean. The bathroom was very small, and the shower head was a bit awkward, but everything was functional. We had an excellent view of Big Ben and the London Eye from our window (we were on the fifth floor), Other guests in the building were courteous and quiet after hours, so we both slept soundly. I'm not sure why so many people have complained about the breakfast on this site. Of course, neither me nor my mom are accustomed to eating massive greasy meals early in the morning. A couple of slices of toast with jam and coffee were just what we needed and we were thrilled that they were free. There are a variety of cooked breakfasts available for a reasonable charge for the gluttonous travelers. The best thing about this hotel by far was the location. We walked to every restaurant (I recommend Chimes for their roast lamb) and most of the attractions including Parliament, Westminster, Buckingham Palace, Harrods, and the Apollo Victoria theatre (we saw Wicked, which was absolutely fabulous) and all of the beautiful gardens. For places that were a bit further away, Victoria Station was a short walk from the hotel steps. If you expect five-star accommodations, you should expect to pay for a five-star hotel. Besides, if you're spending a lot of time in your hotel room while surrounded by everything that London has to offer, you're wasting a trip. Huttons Hotel offers a comfortable, affordable and convenient place to keep your luggage and rest after long, exciting days in an incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “think again”
Reviews.Author: susie m
Reviews.Content: terrible room small with a smelly blanket very small bathroom i was under the impression all rooms had telephones which they do not for breakfast you have to go to the basement which wasnt to bad but this place is not 3 star they dont deserve 1star it really is terrible

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 star Hotel. So you are warned !!”
Reviews.Author: LuiscPeru
Reviews.Content: We came to Huttons by a travel agency. They offered many options and I chose this hotel because its proximity to Victoria Station and because it was rated a 3 star hotel. I reserved for two nights, but I was with my family and stayed only one night. My wife was getting cold and there was no way to increase the temperature, because heating was off. When I demanded the reception about the heating system they said, that if was going to be on in 10 minutes because it was centrlly controlled. There were 2 degrees in London and there was no way to raise the temperature in our rooms. The room that was given to my daughter had a 14 inches CRT television, a little bit smaller than my laptop screen. In summary, the rooms are so small, they have been added a portable bathroom (the ones you can see in building constructions) in all rooms in order to have the rooms private baths. There is no space for anything, Breakfast is served in the basement, and there are no enough tables for all visitors. The day I stayed I had to form a queue in order to get a table and then another to get some food. I have reviewed star rating in UK and a required condition for a hotel to be a 3 star hotel is to have telephones in all rooms. Huttons does not have telephones in their rooms . Thus there is no wake up service. This hotel honestly deserves ONE STAR. I can understand the owner’s all measures they have taken to increase the star rating to this hotel cheating UK authorities. They are therefore bad people, who don’t worry for customers.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped is an understatement”
Reviews.Author: candowildo
Reviews.Content: Booked into Huttons as the Location suited. It was described as traditional rooms with free wifi! The photos show standard double & single rooms and being a regular traveller I had no concerns. I did not expect to be greeted with the reality of Huttons!! Cramped is and an understatement!! In a room big enough for a single bed, I was stunned to find a single & a double!! 5cm space on one side of the bed and maybe 15 cm on the other!! No more than 20cm between the foot of the double & the side of the single!! WIFI?? Couldn't access it so when I asked at reception, I was told 'your on the 5th floor and the wifi doesn't go that high'! You can only get a coffee at breakfast and the instant in the room should be challenged under advertising standards!! And if you are claustrophobic at all - the lift is not for you! Particularly when it drops as soon as you step in it!! But it was cheap!! Only stayed one night out of two!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: paul t
Reviews.Content: To start of with, when you rate a room or a hotel or a Villa or a Mansion 1st see what it is rated example 1 star? 2,3,4,5, or what ever , Then see how it was booked ,,was it on last minute basis ?? or you had the chance to choose. I had the chance to choose i looked for a 3 star hotel in London i looked for a good location near an important sub, rail, bus station (Victoria station ) i looked for a good price and I chose Huttons .I read a couple of views and true i was a bit scared of what i was going to find but i made the choice and said to my family ..we will have to see for ourselves. We got there at 6.00pm Receptionist was very helpful told us what ever we needed to know even gave us a map ,gave us our key card and went up to our room the room number was 405. We went in the room and we looked to see what we have and what we don't we are a family of 4 . we had a double bed and 2 singles 2 side tables a clothes hanging space and an ensuite ,a small shelve for tea and coffee.apart from a window that at night we could see the London eye.Now some important notes Was the room small ? YES but good enough Was the ensuite Small?? Yes but again good enough Was the room a bit noisy ? maybe lift noise or people corridor traffic???Well yes but what do expect from a London 3 star Hotel ?? all that is all normal in a London Hotel .if you dont want that you should book a room in the country side. it was very good for the price paid and it was clean ,cleaned everyday , tea and coffee updated every day,towels changed everyday, beds updated everyday room was updated every day. Breakfast area clean , true we had toast butter cheese jam coffee,tea cereal as much as we wanted but dear lord what do people except a 4 coarse meal??? if you wanted extra's like bacon sausages or what ever there was a small charge no big deal at all.Apart from that they had 3 double toasters everything in order and the staff was excellent very helpful and tables cleaned at once.The Hotel is just a 10minute walk from Victoria station and Victoria station has the lot ,Transit to Gatwick airport ,trains to main cities in Europe, trains to English stations, Underground, and Bus stations, taxis you name it. If you are a true traveler you can walk to marble arch in 50 minutes or to Buckingham Palace in 35 .Also the hotel has another underground nearby only 10 minutes walk again ,its Pimlico station .The hotel has a near bus stop also. Well i think that's enough to guide you,. All i can say is i have stayed in many London hotels and beleive me , i have slept in more expensive rooms than this and was very disappointed, This London hotel was value for money ,I would go again and again as i said before i stayed in 405 i used the breakfast area and the reception and in my opinion it was very very satisfactory Paul T_ _ _ _ _ from Malta

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, but the room was horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Vulcan131
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for 3 nights, the location was perfect for my needs with 10 minutes walk from Victoria Station. The reception Staff were really helpful and nice. However i was given a first floor room. The rooms are like a prison cell. There are too much noises from other rooms and doors... People pass in-front of your room you can even hear their breath. The corridors are just a meter wide. You can hear the lift going up and down every minute even during the night and it sounds like an old tractor. The toilet cubical is too small which includes a shower too. Its like a telephone boot. The Linen was clean and changed every morning ..... This cost me 160 for three nights which included breakfast. However the breakfast only consist of a toast with jam or with cheese (only) and butter, plus Tea or Coffe. They say that you will also have a telephone in the room however No rooms have telephone. The TV set is on analogue system and its very old. You will have only 5 channels. So if you happen to book this hotel, make sure you insert earmuffs if you wish to try to sleep. Not value for money i am afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely reception, helpful stafff, disappointing room!”
Reviews.Author: Lou201
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small and cramped and looked like you had travelled back to the 80's, the bathrooms reminded me of an aeroplane toilet, unfriendly! The bathroom door didn't shut nor lock and i didn't enjoy seeing the dirty laundry chucked on the floor while coming out of the lift back to the hotel room. However, the staff were very friendly and helpful. They sorted out our complaints straight away! I probably would not stay here again on a leisure trip and pay a little bit extra for a lot more! Maybe if i was backpacking and short for cash, then i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not for claustrophobics”
Reviews.Author: RickWallis
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel because of location - close to Victoria station and to the Embankment - and price: Â£60 for a single room for the night. I just wanted a bed for the night in the right place. The single room assigned was the smallest I've ever stayed in: it felt like a converted linen cupboard, on the stairs between floors, with _just_ enough room for a small single bed and a bathroom 'pod'. Lost a point because there were no towels in the room on arrival, but swiftly and politely dealt with by reception staff. Lost another point because of missing TV remote and poor sound insulation - returning guests woke me up. But cheap, honest and clean. I felt I got what I paid for, and would stay again in similar circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel And Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: lem01uk69
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Huttons and I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to London. The hotel kindly lets you store your luggage before and after check out, which is a great help arriving at 6.30 am on the bus from Glasgow. The room was spotless and I had the luxury of a king size bed. The pod style shower room is small, but I managed fine (and I am not a size 6, 4 foot beanpole). The breakfast was good and the breakfast room was very clean. I found out this trip that Pimlico underground is actually closer than Victoria. This hotel is very handy for anyone arriving at Victoria Station or Victoria Coach Station. All in all a very good hotel for the very reasonable room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: rog5000
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms and quiet environment, close to Victoria station. Great place to sleep while visiting London.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable for a night in central London”
Reviews.Author: politicsandrew
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are smallish and the bathrooms (or showeroom in my case) are VERY small but if you are looking for a fairly comfortable, clean, well priced hotel in central London in which to crash at the end of a busy day you can't complain. It's a 5-10 minute walk from Victoria station, staff are very friendly, there's free WIFI and I slept well. Would be very happy to stay there again when I next need a night in London

Reviews.Title: “Even a child would struggle to fit in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: hallamfoe
Reviews.Content: If you are claustrophobic in any way or taller than average, this is definitely not for you. The bathroom is absolutely tiny with the shower right next to the loo, barely separated by a mouldy shower curtain. By the way the earlier description of the shower resembling an upright plastic coffin is very accurate. Seriously, you need to be a contortionist to be able to get out of the shower and back into your room, the shower soaks the bathroom floor so you will skid and bang your shins on the bed. No wardrobe, nowhere to put a suitcase, I began to feel horribly claustrophobic in my room which was taking on the character of a prison cell. The chemical toilet aroma infiltrates the room - it is really unpleasant. The lift accommodates up to three people and is very doddery - it jolts and shudders its way up and down - not at all reassuring. Despite this I couldn't face dragging my heavy suitcase down five narrow flights of stairs, but after waiting for ten minutes I gave up. Breakfast is basic. Cheap cardboard croissants, make your own toast, cereal, one type of very cheap tea bags and coffee. Cooked breakfast is available for an extra charge, but believe me I didn't want to hang around and was desperate to escape. It may be in a good location, but this is the only thing I can recommend

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: frepie
Reviews.Content: The rooms are rather small, the bathroom is small, too. In the room was a kettle but there was no fridge. The breakfast is nice but not a lot to choose from: bread, butter, jam, some muesli. But the location is wonderful. The hotel is just 5 minutes from Pimlico and 10-15 minutes from Victoria Station where you can get a bus to almost any place in central London. There is also a bus stop just near the hotel front door, but only 1 or 2 buses stop there. Also near hotel is Tesco (about 2-3 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the centre of London”
Reviews.Author: superstarintheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night and we liked it. It is nothing special but if you are looking for a place to rest that does not have bed bugs this is okay. The hotel is in the centre of London very close to Victoria tube, train and coach station and to Pimlico tube station. You can reach by walk the Big Ben and other turistic attractions plus in Victoria you will fine buses pretty much to everywhere. The hotel was clean, we were two people but the room was a triple so it was nice, the bathroom is small but if you stay there for a couple of nights you can live with that. We had the breakfast included ( not the english one, for that you have to pay 4 pounds per person ) the continental breakfast did not have much choices. The staff was neutral, did their duties, nothing more nothing less. We suggest this hotel to people who need a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest problem: It's a hostel advertised as a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PrettyH
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with a great many of the reviews I've just read. If you're paying full price (which I did - Â£77/night for a single room in October?!), you're getting bilked. My review will be as fair as possible, because there are good points (thus my giving it a 2 rather than a 1), but it will be honest, too. Advertising basics like in-room telephones, and then not even having one in the lobby for guests to use, is but one of the many issues at Huttons. Let us begin the long and detailed upside/downside list, and I hope its length doesn't make it unhelpful to potential guests! The upsides: 1) location! As others have noted, there's a bus stop right in front, and it's also a very easy walk to get to Victoria Station (I'm disabled, needing a cane to walk sometimes, so if I can say it's a decent walk, most people will find it a breeze!). If you're comeone who likes to walk about and see a neighbourhood that way, there's lots to look at in the surrounding blocks & it's not far from some of the biggest tourist attractions in London, not to mention a lot of the best West End theatres. 1b) NEARBY SHOPS, PUBS, CORNER STORES, ETC. An extension of the points for location: the shops and small eateries in the immediate area. Very handy to have convenience stores only a block away (a note to people who like to travel via public transit: most of the nearby mini-marts will top up your Oyster card for Â£5, so you can use the bus and tube system exhaustively that way!). It's only two or three blocks to walk to a full-on market if you're looking for more than just packets of gum or cookies. Less than a block away is a shop that sells an array of wines/beer/spirits and basic foodstuffs. There are some kitschy shops as well, not tourist traps but places with interesting character, that are worth a browse. Several of them are charity stores, which is a bonus. If you need to shop for pretty much anything, necessity-wise - food, drink, snacks, books, umbrellas, postcards/stamps, phone cards, even some clothes - you'll find a shop right within that block that sells it. 2) TOLERABLE NOISE LEVELS FROM OUTSIDE. Even though I was unable to close the window in my room (it was open when I arrived, and my arms weren't long enough to even attempt to reel it in - it stands to note, though, that I didn't ask the staff to help, so it's not on them), I found the noise outside tolerable, especially given that the 24 bus that runs along Belgrave and stops outside is a round-the-clock route. It helps that my room faced the back/"courtyard" (though I'll address a negative about *that* later), so if you're sensitive to outside noise, request a room that doesn't front onto the main road. 3) A SINGLE TRAVELLER *CAN* FIT IN A SINGLE ROOM. If you're a solo traveller, like I was, the rooms are still astonishingly small, but they can accommodate one person's luggage and you probably won't bark your shins on everything. (If you happen to have a friend stop in to meet up with you, though, it's true that two people cannot conceivably pass one another inside the room, not without one person having to sit on the bed while the other one squeezes past! And I'll address the bathroom in a moment...under the "downsides" heading.) 4) HOUSEKEEPING. The housekeeping staff is lovely. They readily knock on doors at a reasonable hour for jet-lagged folks - usually around 1 p.m. - to offer fresh towels each day, and both young women I spoke to were very pleasant and cheerful. 5) DECENT CURTAINS/DRAPES. In my room, at least, I found that the curtains were heavy enough to keep it from getting unbearably bright when I needed to sleep in and shake off the jet lag. The lace sheers underneath give a bit of privacy when the drapes themselves are open, and they allow fresh air to come in if you leave your window open while you're out for the day. 6) THE CYCLE PARK. Across the road and down maybe half a block you'll find a stable of bicycles that you can pop some coins in and rent for the day, which is a great alternative to walking if you know the best areas for biking. The downsides: 1) IMPOLITE, UNHELPFUL RECEPTION STAFF. The desk staff are the complete opposite of the housekeeping staff. Very unpleasant to deal with, and I'm not someone who has reason to complain about such things very often at all. My check-in took a long time, and when I had finally gotten up to my room one floor up, I'd barely set my bags down when the desk clerk knocked at my door, informing me that he had accidentally authorized my credit card for only the first night, and he needed me to come back dow to reception to pay the full amount for my stay right then and there. The receipts made little sense, so I'll have to check my credit card statement to make sure I didn't get double-billed for a night! 1b) STAFF EVEN RUDE ABOUT THINGS THE HOTEL SAYS IT HAS. Another issue with desk staff: It is advertised on Huttons' website (and right on the envelope in which you're given the room key, in fact) that every room has a telephone, and even modem access. I'd left my itinerary and hotel phone #s for family back in Canada so they could ring me and see that I'd arrived safely at each leg of my journey. Before I had a chance to let them know that there were no phones of any sort, not even a pay phone in the lobby, my mother rang from Canada and asked the front desk if she could be patched through to my room. She was very impolitely told that "we don't have phones in the rooms here, so I suggest you tell your daughter to buy a prepaid mobile and talk to her that way," and then he hung up on her! 2) THE NAUSEATING SMELL OF THE BLANKETS. Contrary to the reviews which stated that the room was "absolutely fine as long as you were out and about most of the day," I have to say that my experience was not as good. After being out with friends for hours and being tired enough to finally return and get some sleep, I laid down on the bed for the first time and was horrified to find that the smell of it made me feel sick! I can't even describe it; it smelled terribly musty, but there was something worse to that scent (urine? mothballs? sweat?? Possibly all of the above). I honestly thought I might be ill if I couldn't escape it, and contemplated sleeping whilst sitting up in the small chair stuffed into the corner of the room. Mercifully the sheets and pillow cases smelled faintly like bleach, which indicated cleanliness, at least. I narrowed down the source of the terrible smell and found it was the top blanket, which I promptly tossed off my bed and left in the corner nearest the window. I was lucky to find another blanket on a rack of clothes hangers that didn't smell as dirty as the first, so if you have the same problem, do look up on the one shelf there is in the room, and you may luck out like I did. I was reluctant to even consider asking the desk staff for new bedclothes after already being treated quite rudely twice on my first day there! 3) THE BATHROOM. You've already read it all by now, I'm sure, but I have to add my voice to the chorus. It is a bizarre contraption, almost certainly a modified port-a-potty normally used in coach buses or caravans/RVs. A person of average size cannot turn around in any direction without hitting the wall, the sink, the toilet, or - god forbid - slipping down the treacherous couple of inches which are all that separate rest of the bathroom's floor from the "shower." I felt like I had to get better at yoga when first attempting to wash my hair (another side note: if you do book here, bring *something* that resembles soap or shampoo, as it's not supplied, not even for purchase. There isn't even a single cheap bar of soap by the sink for hand-washing - a lot of which you will be wanting/needing to do after using these facilities! - and the hand-soap pump affixed to the shower wall may not work or may be empty). Despite ensuring that the shower curtain was pulled properly around before even turning the water on, a good deal of water did flood its way onto the floor in front of the toilet and sink, so I had to use a towel to sop it up as best I could. I regretted not having brought some kind of flip-flops or pool shoes, as setting bare feet onto any part of that floor, let alone the shower, made me worry about catching something. Also worth noting (ESPECIALLY FOR DISABLED/ELDERLY/INJURED/PREGNANT GUESTS) is the fact that the bathroom, quite obviously just built into a corner that may once have been a closet, is RAISED. You'll need to take a step nearly a foot high to climb into the bathroom, and even able-bodied people seem to require hanging onto something to avoid falling straight into the toilet. Because of the proximity to the bed, and the strange wood-and-plastic door being all that's between the sleeping quarters and the "washing up" quarters, the smell of the toilet is unavoidable within the room. It's quite an unpleasant scent even before anyone has used the facilities, probably due to mould and whatever is used in the toilet tank. It really is very much like the smell of the chemical toilets you'd use on a plane or a long bus ride...but the bathrooms on those are actually bigger in some cases. (A friend of mine who is a bit on the taller side than I am - she's 5'8" - had to ask me to leave the hotel room completely in order for her to use the toilet, as she was unable to close the bathroom door due to her knees sticking out too far! THAT is how small these things are.) 3b) GUESTS WITHOUT THE ENSUITE USE A TOILET YOU CAN HEAR FROM YOUR ROOM ALL TOO WELL ON THE GROUND FLOOR. I was one floor up from the lobby, and I believe the shared bathroom for guests who didn't get rooms with ensuites is on the basement floor, which also happens to be on the same level as the "courtyard" in the back. If you have a room that faces onto that side, you won't hear as much road noise, but you *will* hear very noisy plumbing out there all night long. For my first night there, I kept thinking it must've just begun to pour rain or hail outside for all the racket; it took me looking out there in daylight to determine what I was actually hearing. 4) VERY THIN WALLS. I was lucky to be sharing my floor with considerate guests, I think, but I was still able to hear my neighbours' TVs blaring quite often, and I could hear every snore coming from the room to my left each night. Again, if you're sensitive to noise, I'd recommend bringing ear plugs. Planes to and from Gatwick also seem to have a flightpath directly above, so earplugs aren't a bad idea anyway! 5) NO PHONES AND NO INTERNET ACCESS IN THE ROOMS. It is possible to hook up to a free wifi signal from your room if you're tenacious enough (try connecting via free-internet.com or free-hotspot), but the connection only lasts a short time before you're bumped offline and have to trudge through the process again. The reference made on the hotel's website to "free internet available in public areas" seems to be referring to the solo desktop computer situated in a corner of the lobby. As for the aforememtioned telephones, if you're not originally from the UK or don't already own a mobile, you'll need either a cheap pay-as-you-go cell phone, or a calling card which you can use in one of the two phone boxes across the road and down the street. (I don't recommend doing that at night, however. Like other reviewers, I was surprised to discover how many "unsavoury" sorts will harass you if you're in those phone boxes after about 10 p.m.) 6) THE LIFT. It's very rickety and a little bit scary, actually, even to someone who doesn't have issues with such things! It's incredibly small, and very slow, which must be why management has posted a sign limiting the number of people who are allowed to use the lift with luggage in hand to 3. My room was the second one in, so I could only barely hear the creaking/banging/doors grinding shut, but I heard the gentleman in the room between mine and the lift complaining about it keeping him awake at night. Be mindful of that if you're booking - request a room away from the lift if you can. Whew. I really hope that was helpful, for all of my blathering! There are other, smaller complaints - the dusty and stale packages of coffee/tea in the room, the wall lamp meant for reading that wasn't working, and the fact that you have to pay between Â£1-Â£2 if you want a bottle of water from the fridge in the lobby - but I mainly wanted to get into the stuff that would be a dealbreaker to a lot of travellers. This is less a hotel and more a HOSTEL, but at a cost you'd expect to pay for a Travelodge or Premier Inn, ones with normal bathrooms that don't jut out into the room and smell terrible, and access to a telephone! The place was completely full, a big No Vacancies sign on the door even mid-week, for my entire 3-night stay, so clearly the accomodations are acceptable enough to stay well in business. Bottom line, for me: It's badly misrepresented, costs far too much for what you get, and would appeal more to teenagers or college kids who are accustomed to backpacking/using hostels than it would to anyone in *any* other demographic. Photos to come. Use it as a location-friendly last resort only!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Laura P
Reviews.Content: - staff were not overly friendly. I could barely understand what they were saying and I am a native English speaker! - My room was roughly 1.5m x 2m. I could not open the door in or the bathroom door because I had to put my suitcase in the middle of the floor. - the bathroom was like a portable bathroom thrown into this 'room'. A small child would barely be able to fit in the bathroom. Everything would get wet. The smell from the bathroom was hideous. The toilet still had someone elses faeces in the bowl when I arrived. - I was afraid of getting bed bug bitten, so I wore layers of clothes. - The TV remote was lost. The TV had 2 channels that actually worked; the rest did not. - Breakfast was fairly poor; they really only offered toast and two cereals (a coeliac's nightmare). Overall, horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some!”
Reviews.Author: carole1961England
Reviews.Content: I am always anxious when checking into non-chain accomodations due some of the disasters we have experienced, especially in London, even after reading reviews, etc. There must be a happy medium between a dump and a too expensive place to stay. So I was pleasantly surprised with Huttons Hotel conveniently located in the Pimlico area of London. Yes, the rooms and bathroom are small, just one pillow per bed, and check out is an early 10:00 am. However; the rooms were clean, the staff polite, the price somewhat reasonable for London, and the location was good to boot. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “No recomendable”
Reviews.Author: BPC2011
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, too small. Despite is clean. Bathrooms too small like a cabin of a vessel. Not room even in the shower. Too small rooms. If you travel in a couple and need a duble bed room, please don't accept room number 102. Is like cabin of "Marx" brother's film. Incredible. Continental breakfast is for only: toast, cheese orange juice, coffee or tea. That's all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Gameoldbird
Reviews.Content: Went to see cricket at the Oval and this hotel was a good choice as I was on a budget. It is so close to so many things to see and do. The staff were polite and very helpful. The rooms are as you would expect for the price, however the coffee and tea was plentiful and the room was quiet, considering the location in the heart of London. A bargain.

Reviews.Title: “I recomend to anybody looking for good value!”
Reviews.Author: vintage-pirate
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a lovely area. The surrounding buildings & the hotel are all cream painted georgian buildings & the area has such a friendly vibe about it. There's a bus stop straight over the road with a 24 hour bus service, however Victoria & Pimlico tube stations are both just a short walk in each direction. Also the coach station & train station are close enough to walk to without any problem. There are some lovely pubs & restaurants near by & I would heartily recomend the St Georges Tavern for a reasonably priced meal & a drink. Me & my daughter stayed in room 200. We had origionaly booked a twin but somehow ended up with a double, but it was no problem for us & we turned down an offer to change rooms the next day as this room had a fantastic balcony with a view over the street. We found the room to be clean & compact but certainly big enough for us two & our shoes! The bathroom was a bit of a joke however, small didnt really describe it. We use to have a touring caravan & Im fairly sure the bathroom in it was bigger! Never the less there was a loo, sink & shower & it was clean & served us well for our 3 night stay. Plenty of clean towels changed daily, but sadly no soap...random! The maid came in every day & made the bed, cleaned round ect... all very good. There were tea&coffee making facilities & a hairdryer & a shaver point for anybody who might need one. The breakfast was included in the price of the room & was a continental offering, cerials, toast & jams, cheese, tea, coffee & juice. A full English was available for just Â£4 & you could pay the waitress on the day if you felt the need to have one. We found the staff to be very friendly & they had maps & such in reception if you needed one. I read some of the previous reviews of this hotel & feel people are complaining about trivial things really! We were two women (aged 18 & 39) & we used the hotel mainly to sleep in as we spent all day sight seeing & we ate out everynight, we loved it & would definately stay there again. If you want a reasonably priced London hotel in a safe, friendly area with good transport links then this is the hotel for you. If you want a boutique hotel with 24 hour room service, swimming pool & spa then stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been okay for 33% of what they charge”
Reviews.Author: BusTrav180
Reviews.Content: Nothing wrong with this hotel except the price. Why would anyone pay GBP 75 to 99(!) for this hotel when others are three times better for the same price? I'll be back when the tariff is GBP 30. But it's a beautiful street. And the breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “everything fine without problems”
Reviews.Author: ste11p
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice in a quiet location without noise.Very clean rooms which are exactly like these that the photos show.Fine central heating and Hot water any time although the bathroom was a little bit small. Very kind stuff and always there to help you and give advice about where to go are how to go. Nice and simple breakfast.It's Close to the center and Big Ben and around 15 minutes walk (if you don't go by bus) from Victoria Station. There is a bus stop in front of the hotel where the bus pases through Victoria Station, Big Ben and Trafalgar Square. Very convenient root for turists. I'd stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy, no frills accomodation!!!”
Reviews.Author: jandlfulton
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed here over night to extend our wedding anniversary, and we weren't expecting much as we got it for a good price. The reception area looked good, and although the staff member that served us appeared to want to be somewhere else, he did halfheartedly show us to our room and we were given very vague directions to get to the dining room for breakfast in the morning. Unfortunately it went downhill from there, as we had been given room no:116 which was in the basement. The room itself was clean and tidy and although the door to the ensuite shower room needed a good push to get it to stay it shut! It was a reasonable size and the shower appeared to be quite a new installment. The double bed was very comfortable and had my husband and I fallen out, we had the benefit of an extra single bed in the room. The TV on the wall worked and we were supplied with tea and coffee facilities, clean towels and a hairdryer, but were surprised to have no complimentary toiletries available or a lid on the soap despenser on the sink. However the best was yet to come, on returning to the hotel to sleep that night we were very pleased to find it lovely and quiet, however this only lasted until 06:30 in the morning when we were disturbed by lots of scraping and banging from the room next door. On leaving our room at 07:30 to go and have breakfast the noise had got louder, but again we just assumed that the kitchen had got busier. My husband and I then went up the stairs and through the hotel as we had been advised to do so by the receptionist the night before. On arriving at the dining room, we found it unwelcoming and there were no staff around, we sat there a little dazed and eventually we gave up on the idea of breakfast and resided ourselves to just having toast, especially when we realised that we needed cash to pay the extra to have the fry up as we had already fully paid for our room and so couldn't have it charged to it (this annoyed us greatly as I had specifically asked the evening before whether we had too prepay for our breakfast or not, etc and had been told that that it was fine to just pay in the morning). My husband and I then got up to leave the dining room and noticed that there was an extra door out of the dining room at the other end to the one we had entered, we then noticed that it directed us to our door number this way, so we left that way, AND ON GOING THROUGH THE DOOR WE WERE GREETED BY THE DOOR TO OUR ROOM BEING IMMEDIATELY ON THE LEFT!!! meaning that the noise we had heard earlier had been diners moving about and scraping chairs, etc. This really annoyed us and we would never stay here again, especially as we feel that the staff had deliberately kept this information from us, as not only was the sign missing from the door, but we had been directed the other way to the dining room the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mary_horgan2002
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Saturday 12th Feb 2011 and first impressions of hotel were not bad. Then we wre given our room and it all went downhill from there. We were given a room in the basement near the dining area and the noise in the morning was terrible and woke us each morning of our stay. The bedroom was tiny and the shower was actually in the room and not the bathroom where you might expect to find it. We had no wardrobe and just a few hangers to hang up our clothes. The staff were mostly pleasant but did find it strange that the cleaners would just let themselves into your room without knocking first. I certainly would not stay here again but maybe the rooms above ground level are better...I don't know and won;t go back to find out either.....

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mazdadan
Reviews.Content: What a horrible place to stay, we travelled all round the uk and this was the worst accom. by a long way,no wifi,terrible service,bathroom looks like someone stuck a porta-loo inside the room. Pretty dodgy area too didn't feel safe walking around after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: shylock300
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were booked in to stay at another hotel, however due to maintenance issues, we were moved over to Huttons. Things just seemed to go downhill from there. Service was poor, it took between 5 and 10mins to get checked as no one was at reception and there was no way to get their attention and the staff member wasn't welcoming. We were given a small twin bedroom with old fashioned decor and the state of the room was questionable. Cleanliness quality is sub standard. We had mould on the ensuite door handle and we found hairs and stains on our sheets and duvets. When we asked for clean sheets, the staff member wasn't bothered, dumped the new sheets right on top of the old one and wasn't at all helpful or offer to change the sheets and asked if we wanted new ones! The hotel is not well maintained judging by the state of the bathroom and the massive hole we found at the corner of the room that was hidden behind a side table. Overall I would not recommend this to anyone. The room was small, the ensuite shower pod was small and dirty, the staff were not helpful, cleanliness was substandard and the service was poor. Looking up the prices, it's no wonder the place is a dump. It's cheap for a reason and not a good one. I've stayed in hostels that were better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mkss
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good for the price, hence the 4 point overall score. From my perspective it was well located close the the Tube station, if you turn right out of the hotel there are some nice restaurants and a Cafe Nero a few mins walk away. The breakfast arrangements were good.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dekchai
Reviews.Content: I paid Â£45 for one night in a single room (prepaid rate). The room was very basic and very small and the toilet was small and cramped. But the bed was reasonably good and everything was clean. To stay in the Victoria area for that price is an incredible value for money, I did check Holiday Inn Express at the same street and their rate was Â£200 per night. So if you are after a no frills hotel in central London then by all means this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: eclizzie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2-day theatre trip and our first visit to this Hotel. We had a brilliant time, the room was large and well decorated with wooden floor and we were down in the basement which was very quiet and suited us perfectly, albeit down a few stairs. The bathroom ,as already reported by others, was a shower module and therefore very small but clean and it served the purpose well. We found the staff very helpful and had no problems at all. The locked luggage room is brilliant and suited us as we were not travelling home till later in the evening of the day we checked out - no problems in leaving our luggage for the whole day. The continental breakfast certainly doesn't have much choice, - toast, cereal and fruit juice - but we opted for paying the small charge for a cooked option which was delicious. All in all, we had a great stay and for an affordable hotel so near the centre of the city and with the buses running across from the hotel and the nearby Tube/Buses at Victoria this is an ideal base for a weekend break or short stay (for those who can't put up with small bathrooms). If you want big rooms all the time then you have to be prepared to pay megga bucks or put up with big room small bathroom, or small room big bathroom, take your pick! As long as things are clean and staff helpful then that's what counts. We will certainly stay at the Huttons in the future.

Reviews.Title: “OMG Terrible - Avoid”
Reviews.Author: del80y
Reviews.Content: We were in room 205, right by the lift !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Good Points The staff were excellent and the beds were made up daily together with fresh towels provided on a daily basis. The location was very good. Bad Points We were in room 205 and the noise from the lift kept us awake at night - not suitable for a family. The level of cleanliness in the room was below the standard I would expect from this standard of hotel. The ensuite was tiny, anyone of a large stature would struggle with the size of the shower and ensuite. The shower floods the ensuite floor - very slippy, we had to put towels down to soak up the water and to prevent any accidents. There was mould - possibly from condensation in the top left hand corner of the bedroom and upon arrival the room did in fact smell very musty. There was a damp stain at ceiling level on the left hand wall of the bedroom. The plastic flusher of the toilet was cracked and dirty, could harbour germs. Overall very poor not good value although cheap,. Sydney hotel opposite altogether better and very comparable price wise.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but cramped”
Reviews.Author: Kildress
Reviews.Content: Firts of all the bathroom complaints in many of the reviews are correct... The bathrooms are essentially a pre-fab pod inserted into an already small room. They are like what you would get on an overnight ferry boat. Water pressure was a little low but otherwise it sufficed. The rooms are small, ours had two single beds and one bedside cabinet between. No wardrobe but hanger rails were fitted. Tea/Coffee facilities were provided in the room. It was calmmy in July and we needed to keep the wonodw open, the street was moderately noisy (traffic not late night revellers) but bearable. Breakfast was limited in range and the room was busy. However, cereal, toast and coffee was useful to start the day. The location is good, a 15min walk (max) to Victoria. This (as well as price) was a reason for our choice of this hotel. I could find nothing else available in this price range, I resent paying dear for a room in which I will only sleep! We left in the morning and returned at night. We didn't need much in terms of facilities. This worked for me.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Accommodation for the budget Traveller but bathroom is tiny!”
Reviews.Author: ShinieDublin
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in this hotel and overall my experience staying here was ok. The room was cleaned very day and fresh towels. Unlike some reviews, my room did have a hair drier and a rail ot hang clothes. The bed was hard so it was difficult to sleep in the the bathroom, well, I've never been in to such a small bathroom in all my life. I've a small frame and I'm glad I'm not any bigger because I'd have found it hard to move in the shower, it was so small. There was also a wash hand basin and toilet within inches of each other.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: 255093Deirdre
Reviews.Content: if you want clean room and ensuite, good breakfast and hospitality . my room did not have a wardrobe but plenty of room to hang clothes to air.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad”
Reviews.Author: Teaselshiva
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once before and the worst feature was the dreadfully small bathroom. One shoulder in tthe shower, the other in the wash hand basin and knees jammed against the door and thats while sittng on the loo. This time they bounced my reservation and nothing I wcould say or produce would make them change their minds so I had to perforce to search for another - and this at 1030 at night. Not funny - and I am very angry about it.

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1 night if you get it at a very discount price”
Reviews.Author: poppieEngland
Reviews.Content: Had a twin room, budget room decor, bigger bathroom in a touring caravan. Luggage store fantastic. Breakfast poor. Handy location. Pleased we didnt pay full price!

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable 2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Tegwyn_10
Reviews.Content: Huttons Hotel was situated a walk away from Victoria and Pimlico Tube Stations and also on a direct bus route. The draw back, was the hotel room. A slightly tatty box room, in which 2 single beds had been squeezed. Every time you walked from the beds to the door, you would hit your knee against the corner of the one bed because only one leg would fit at a time through the gap. Don't expect any wardrobe or chest to hang any clothes as there is only a small hanging rail attached to the wall for a few garments of clothing. No hairdryer in room as stated, when I asked for one at reception, they said they had none. This room was not on their website, I wonder why!! It did have an on-suite bathroom but only one person at a time could fit. I am a slight framed person so can't understand who this room would be suitable for, maybe a few brooms!!

Reviews.Title: “very small..”
Reviews.Author: joy704
Reviews.Content: we had the double ensuite room. loved the location was walking distance to the train station and bus station. Not too far (was able to walk) and see buckingham palace and big ben. The room was very small. Had a really bad weird smell to it. For some reason it had a dirty feel to it. The bathroom was a whole other story, had a bad smell coming from it and it reminded me of a porta potty but with a tiny, and i mean tiny shower space. Their was an extra pillow in our closet and the gross part was it smelled like pee. Breakfast was ok. if you don't pay extra all you really get is toast, 2 choices of cereal, orange juice, cheese, and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Well, it's Â£55 for the night - which is about Â£50 more than it's worth”
Reviews.Author: TheGibbler
Reviews.Content: If you like having a toilet in the bedroom (feels that way), a bed that feels like it's full of bones and noisy German students down the hallway slamming doors all night then this is the hotel for you. It's not 3 stars and the websiteis very misleading. It's cheap and warm, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Bathrooms and very bad breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AaronMalta
Reviews.Content: There were no balcony in the room. The Bathrooms were too small. There aren't enough space to have a normal showers. It's too small. Breakfast was very bad, there were no choice, you have to eat what they will give you. The best thing I found is that a bus stop is infront of the door. And if you want to use Victoria Station, it is few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “ok for one night”
Reviews.Author: jaed49
Reviews.Content: The location was what led us to Huttons. It is in walking distance of the Pimlico tube stop and Bus 24 (and near a house we rented for the rest of the trip.) The rooms were incredibly small, especially the bathroom. The toilet in the quad room never did flush properly, even after the staff came and looked at it several times. Breakfast was good and the ladies who staffed the breakfast room were wonderful and friendly. It is not the worst place I have stayed, but very glad we were only there for one night. If you are just needing a place to sleep (although the beds arent great), it is ok. Noticed several other hotels along Belgrave St so you might check the prices at some of those. Belgrave St is a nice area, easy access to Central London. Lots of good restaurants in the area (Prince of Wales, Marquis of Westminster, The Paradise).

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: nizsat
Reviews.Content: just went recently on 7th march, no cot for the baby, the answer was they only have one and its in use, tiny rooms and very very tiny bathroom you will struggle to get in, rooms very cold as they switch the central heating off through the night so they can save some money. breakfast ; you need to pay additional fee to get the full english however the rest of it is just toast ,butter jam and cereal no variety at .I was really surprised to such a hotel like this withinthe united kingdom and especially in london?????????????????

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice staff, poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: RickH86
Reviews.Content: The location is great -short walk from Victoria Station, or Bus 24stop is out front. Our room was clean, and the staff is very friendly. The breakfast was ok, but we stayed 5 nights, so the lack of variety gets old fast. Others have complained about what was served on the plates, but we just asked the staff and got the combinations that we asked for. However, if you don't eat eggs, you have sausages, beans, tomatoes, toast and corn flakes to choose from. Our room was of adequate size for four, but the bathroom was tiny. The TV was tiny and only got 5 channels, and the phone in our room didn't work. There was no clock in the room, and with no phone, there was no wake up possible. We were on the ground floor and our biggest complaint was the noise - the large undercut on the door let all of the hallway noise directly into our room - we could here anyone talking at normal levels, and the noise from anyone walking around above us was terrible. We had the joy of a German school group (18-19 years old) in the hotel at the same time, so were woken at 1-2 in the morning from the chatting in the hall, or the knocking on the other room doors to be let in.

Reviews.Title: “The shower room was 60cm x120cm & the linen/towels were not fresh.”
Reviews.Author: tjb12
Reviews.Content: The shower room/toilet was smaller than that on an aircraft. The shower cubicle was only 30cm x 60cm, with a dirty and broken shower curtain. There was hardly room to perch on the loo and the flush did not work properly with the noise of a continuously filling cistern keeping us awake most of the night! The bedlinen and the towels stank of stale tobacco which we had to endure throughout our stay (only one night,thankfully). The whole room smelt of cigarette smoke, so what was meant to be a treat turned out to be an unpleasant experience! The problems were relayed to the staff on departure with a promise of a phonecall from the Manager. Four days later and I am still waiting! On calling the hotel myself, I am told the manager is not in and will not be back for several days. I will update this review if I get any satisfactory response.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel central and friendly”
Reviews.Author: jlo1234Usa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights after a long time in europe hoping around city to city . This was one of the best hotels we stayed in it was clean and the staff were great . Best location and there is a number 24 bus outside ( our red limo) works all night and drops outside the door !

Reviews.Title: “Strictly for the students or very low budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: Pepperycat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only one step above a youth hostel, if that. Admittedly it is a fairly low price for central London and includes breakfast. However you're better off not having the breakfast and going to the local cafes. It is a do it yourself affair, cereal, fruit juice and toast fine but the cooked breakfast consists of runny beans, a fried egg, one sausage and a tinned tomato. The room we stayed in bears absolutely no resemblance to the photos you can see on Trip Advisor, ours was tiny and needed decoration. The bathroom miniscule, it was difficult to sit on the toilet and close the door, and at the same time you had to have one foot in the shower! There are no shower caps and it is a fixed shower, although there is a hair dryer in the room. No soap or shampoo either or a plug for the sink. We were on the 5th floor, there was no button in the lift for the 5th floor, and a notice over the top of it saying this was only temporary, could 5th floor occupiers get out at the 4th floor get out and walk up. Fortunately we are fairly fit and didn't have much luggage.

Reviews.Title: “I'm scared i've caught something!”
Reviews.Author: alistergray
Reviews.Content: What can i say, i was offered a room on the fourth floor, in the middle of the stairs... absolute terrible, mouldy net curtains, mini bed, shower so small it was unbelievable, bed was covered in red marks, im hoping it was pen and not blood. burn marks in the sheets and the bed side cabinet. dust all over the floor. I complained and got put in the basement in a double room. But it was a basement, and it was still very small. The Electrics were bodged and hanging off the wall, the lamp was terminated in a box that was just left free to move under the bed. The shower in this room was slightly bigger but still not big enough to stop your foot being i nthe shower when going to the toilet. please do not visit this hotel... the staff were friendly but were running a terrible hotel for someone who should have trading standards take a look. If i have came away from that hotel without a disease i will be happy... its still only been a few days though!

Reviews.Title: “good value and location”
Reviews.Author: diytours
Reviews.Content: We arrived in London at Victoria coach station and the hotel was about a 10 minute walk away. The location for us was perfect within walking distance to Victoria bus and train stations a springboard to the rest of London. For those who don't like walking there is a no. 24 bus which stops right outside of the hotel and then takes you to the station. The foyer was having a make over as we arrived, nice marble tiles they are obviously making an effort to make the initial appearance more attractive. We had room 202 which was a good size, the bed was comfortable and clean as was the rest of the room. The bathroom was a plastic purpose built module slotted into the room, okay it was small but it was clean and served the purpose. Breakfast was a basic affair but the food was well cooked and filling, buffet style cooked breakfast with toast and cereal, the waiting staff were friendly and helpful. Overall I think you have to keep in mind the price paid, we paid Â£65, for a clean and comfortable stay in a hotel at the centre of London which we thought was very good value for money. If you want something more luxurious then I guess the hotels are out there you just have to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location ... beware of the breakfast and bathroom!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulaMalta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a very good location very close to Victoria station.... but the breakfast was horrible no selection of items you just have to order your meal to the waitres no buffet is offered plus they only guve you 2 sausages, 2 eggs and a full can of baked beans unless you complain about it. the bathroom is aproximately 4 feet by 3 feet small you can't even move the shower is so small that water used to go out into our room.

Reviews.Title: “average...”
Reviews.Author: asian_brit
Reviews.Content: booked a triple room, but gave us a family room. room door cudnt open fully, and hits the double bed. the bathroom... more like a wet room with a tiolet, and was soooo small, almost like they had converted a small closet into a bathroom. we paid a budget price with breakfast so u get wot u pay for. location wise, very close to victoria. but ther are better hotels than this in better location!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It - Look Elsewhere!!”
Reviews.Author: anch0rman
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a night, that was too much!! once found and checked in, was given room 112 - which was ''down in the lift, to the lower ground floor, past the breakfast room'' omg!!! it was terrible. we were in our room only minutes before our door, which we had locked, was opened by one of the maids with towels. it was cold (had to ask for a heater) and noisy, as this room was next to the kitchen and back door. our door was then opened a further 3 times, without a knock, by the same maid and her colleague with yet more towels!!! no joke!! i went to reception and complained and got moved up to the 4th floor, which was better, but not great. bathroom is very small and feels like a port-a-loo cabin. will not be staying here again or recommending it!!! you have been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - there are much better hotels close by!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sydney1973
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the unfortunate pleasure (!!) of staying here the first time we came to London in 2007. We were really unhappy with our choice based on our travel agents recommendation. The room was so small - felt like it was too small even for one person and there were two of us!! We only found out about tripadvisor after our trip - if it had been before we would NEVER have stayed here based on the reviews. The breakfast was average but what we really hated the most was the toilet/shower setup - just a plastic shower and toilet cubicle pushed in the corner of the room and it really stunk!!! Made the room even smaller!! Of course though, the photos on the hotel website don't show this!!! The front door had a sticker with three stars - maybe it would be three stars in a third world country but no way in London!!! We checked out after two days intsead of five. Don't stay here - there are much better hotels close to Victoria station like Rubens!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and annoying”
Reviews.Author: docsnuggy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in September 2009 as was good location. I WILL NEVER GO BACK. First off, arrived at around 7pm on the friday night and was staying in room with my partner and friend, so one double bed and a single. Room was small, lots of knee knocking and had to wait turns at mirror. Tea and coffee available but kettle looked like it hadnt been washed for years. Walls dirty with scuff marks. Loo was broken and wouldnt flush, and also kept trickling through out the night. In the morning, we got up for breakfast which was just burnt sausages, eggs and pale looking beans (although full english breakfast advertised). Went back to bed as plans fell through to go out and was disturbed by cleaning lady a total of four times before she got the message that we didnt want service. Our room was next to breakfast room and in the basement so from 7am onwards, there was dripping and staff prancing around in the corridors banging doors and also an annoying washing machine above us. It was terrible. I felt I was trying to sleep while bombing was going on around me. Asked for a room change for the next night but no one seemed to care.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and OK”
Reviews.Author: TeacherStockholm
Reviews.Content: Great location - direct bus just outside to the action and shopping. Small room with tiny bathroom. Clean and cheap. Plus for the cooked breakfast. Places like this usually serve tea & toast.

Reviews.Title: “definitely not a 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: KNTAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on the Sunday night only to be told that there was no hot water due to the boiler being damaged by a flood in the basement caused by a burst water main the previous day. Not their fault and as such they didn't appear to either care or apologise, their only concern was that they had to point out that there was no hot water. They couldn't give an estimate to when it would be back on - when asked if we would be compensated the answer was a simple "bring it up with your agent". Spent the rest of the next day looking for an alternative but decided to stay after hot water came on later that evening. All rooms are filled with beds - regardless of their size - if there's room for another bed you can bet it will be there - very limited floor space. Floors and bathroom (pod!) were clean, however bed linen, pillows & curtains were grimy and set off my son's dust allergies. Breakfast was limited to toast, choice of 2 cereals and a cooked option of eggs, sausage and beans. So many little niggles like the lift, signs of botched repairs, everything appears to have been done on the cheap. This hotel is cheap for a reason. Definitely a lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “great location, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: stelizAyr
Reviews.Content: this hotel was in a fab location,but, the room was dirty, we arrived late,so there was no excuse. the bed cover was all marks, the floor was dirty as was the mirrors. you couldnt swing a cat in it. saying that the staff were all very nice and helpful. i wouldnt stay again, it reminded me of a hostel, for the young and those on a tight budget,its fine, as i said the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “cheaply”
Reviews.Author: save60
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 4 days. The hotel is very cheaply...bed, bathroom, services, breakfast no bacon, noisy... but fortunately waitress are so nice and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother - there's better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireGypsygirl
Reviews.Content: Two single beds crammed into a room only big enough for one bed. - painfully knocked knees on the bed-end! Hardly any storage space. No kettle or milk - though these were brought along when we mentioned the lack. Curtains and blinds broken, so we couldn't shut out the daylight. Tiny bathroom, broken tap and broken loo - though my partner managed to fix the loo. Alleged English breakfast seemed to consist only of small sausages, scrambled egg and beans - and bread/toast. Though we do grant that the bedroom was very clean, our overall impression was that corners had been cut to maximise profit. Huttons is very poor value for money at over Â£70 per night - I've stayed in others nearby and done far better.

Reviews.Title: “great location good value for money”
Reviews.Author: claire7557
Reviews.Content: Great value for money great location would recommend only short walk to Victoria station or bus stop outside hotel .Hotel clean bathroom facilities small & compact but for price cant complain Cooked breakfast wasnt that good but plenty of toast & cereal Surrounding area nice plenty of cafes or restaurants Would deffinately stay again or recommend to friends . We didnt leave London until late & hotel have room you can leave luggage in & collect later

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for adventure”
Reviews.Author: travel_lover_RC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Huttons hotel for a whole week between December, 2008 and January, 2009. I was travelling to London with three of my friends for a holiday. We were staying in a four-bed room. The hotel is quite small but cosy. the rooms are ok, nothing special, just all you need for those using the room just to sleep. the only drawback is the bathroom which is extreemly small...but you get used to it!!! the breakfast offered is good and fresh. we had no complains. it was just what we were searching for...something which is relatively cheap, at the centre of London and we were really lucky as the transport of the buses is quite near the hotel (the bus stop is right in front but only one bus passes). The staff is very friendly and they always try to help you out in every query one may have. I would recommend this hotel to those 17-18th year old guys who have a tight budget and want to experiance a crazy week in London!!!

Reviews.Title: “A horizontal telephone kiosk.”
Reviews.Author: Businesstraveller5
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms in Europe are typically small, but the Hutton is in a class of its own. The single room at which I stayed was precisely 6' 2" (1m 96) square (I'm 6' tall; with my head against one wall, there were two inches of clearance between my feet and the opposite one). Basketball players, or Dutch males, may wish to think twice about booking a stay here. The astonishing tininess of the room aside, your satisfaction with the Hutton is likely to depend principally on how much you paid for it. It's reasonably centrally located: Pimlico and Victoria stations are about 500m away. The no. 24 'bus, which runs throughout the night, passes the front door. It's clean enough, though the furnishings are of the cheapest and plainest. There is almost no heating; the windows are draughty, so the rooms become extremly cold at night. The building is constructed in such a way that nothing can happen in the room immediately above yours without your being aware of it. If, then, you are (i) short; (ii) a sound sleeper; (iii) it is summertime; and (iv) the room is deeply discounted, the Hutton will do for a brief stay. Unless all those things are true, you'd be better advised to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonable rates for New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: Joao_Marcos
Reviews.Content: My family (wife, parents and parents in law) and I spent 3 nights at Huttons hotel from Dec 31st and Jan 3rd 2008 and I can say that it was a good experience at all. I got a very good rate for this period, 72 pounds per night, including continental breakfast. I couldn't expect more than I got considering London at New Year's Eve... I made my reservation almost four months in advance and I didn't face any problems when arriving on Dec 31st. The staff is overall friendly and the hotel is quite clean and organized with an operating lift available. Despite the very tiny loo, the bedroom is suitable for those who want to rest after a tiring day of sightseing. The location is the best part of the stay... It is close to Victoria rail and tube stations and located at a walking distance to Big Ben and London Eye. Of course that it is not true if you are a little bit lazy. It takes 25 min on foot, in average, from the hotel to the Westminster bridge, for instance. I do recommend this hotel if you are looking for a rather comfortable place at reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: FatbankD
Reviews.Content: For 39 pounds you get: - a very central location - a clean individual room with WC and shower and hairdryer and TV - a good and clean bed - buffet all you can eat breakfast - and free wifi (although I am not sure it was from the hotel. But it worked) Sure the rooms are small, the bathroom is a prefab cabinet, and you should hope your neighbours are not on a honey moon. But for that money, it's really valuable.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok”
Reviews.Author: maria_fitz_ni
Reviews.Content: i stayed in the hotel in march last year with my boyfriend. on arrival we were allowed to check in early. i was quite happy with the hotel, however the location of our room was a bit awkard and hard to get to, the room itself was an ok size and had ok facilities for a short stay, however the bathroom was very small and uncomfortable and was like a portaloo with a shower and also our window in the room wouldnt close correctly, staff was friendly and the breakfast was ok, also the hotel allowed us to leave our bags there after checking out.... completly_ginger@live.com

Reviews.Title: “worse hotel in central london”
Reviews.Author: travellerAJGermany
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from London.We have found this hotel via internet. . we were stayed at Huttons hotel for a night ( THANKS GOD). it situated at belgrave Rd near Victoria station.we never ever come across such a hotel that even meet a basic standard. the room are small, Especially BAHTROOM is very very very very tinyl and dirty. you can't even move or turn without bumping the wall.when you want to take a shower you have to stay very very close to the wall because the shower was just 3 or 4 inch stick out of the wall.and worse than that water run even weaker than my P... we will never ever come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.. a budget trip”
Reviews.Author: JaennaShrewsbury
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend with my sisters in the triple room (ground floor level). The hotel had noted my request for 3 single beds and it was set out in a good arrangement - we were satisfied. We expected the room to be fairly basic but still could not believe the 'en-suite' was so tiny.. in fact the shower/loo in my parent's caravan is bigger!!! It also had a smell... not pleasant.. (like the whiff of a urinal!!) however it was clean and so was the room. One of the curtains had partly fallen off which allowed the street light to flood the room at night (they sorted this out on the second night when I insisted on it) and two of the bedside lamps were not working (they managed to fix one of them on the second night too) Although it was a bit noisy at night.. we still felt it was worthwhile to be centrally located and we had the window open wide for air so it could have been quieter if we'd chosen to shut it. The breakfast was fine.. hot but standard... sausages, beans and scrambled eggs.. very basic but we'd expected that. The toast machine worked well and there were cornflakes and a basic muesli mix if we'd wanted it. The staff were cheerful and helpful which was appreciated. We were able to leave our luggage in a small upstairs store at our own risk..there was a simple padlock on the door... a bit nerve racking wondering if it would be there on our return but thankfully no problems! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “London on Shoestring”
Reviews.Author: DarwinPlonker
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here on a 3 day stopover in London. I had been warned about the size of the rooms and yes they are small. The bathroom is even smaller than I thought. That said, you get what you pay for and at 90 pounds per night for 5 people in the centre of London, I though this was great value. The location is great, 5 minutes to Victoria Station and only minutes to anywhere in London from there. The cooked breakfast is great bonus noting the price of food in London. Whilst this is not a 5 star hotel, it is a great budget option for staying in the centre of London.

Reviews.Title: “will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: British_17
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed here for a while and were quite satisfied. The rooms are clean, breakfast is good, the location is great only about 5 minutes walk to victoria station where u can go anywhere from. The price is not bad as well. There is a bus stop in front the hotel with is very convenient, and the staff is friendly. The only negative is as everyone said...the bathroom is very...small. But we would stay here again, the overall experience was great

Reviews.Title: “This place is disgusting”
Reviews.Author: DublinRosiedublin
Reviews.Content: Room stank of cigarette smoke. Bathroom was so so small you could not even turn in the shower. God help people with long hair as you would take forever having a shower with the power. The taps were also coded wrong. Blue was hot and Red was cold. Hair Dryer didn't work... 2 men walked into my room while I was lying on the bed resting. Reception gave them the wrong key. I would not eat breakfast there. the place was so bad I was afraid to go near them for food..

Reviews.Title: “I don't even know what to say”
Reviews.Author: hazel223
Reviews.Content: we got to Victoria station and went to the hotels desk, bad idea!! the man helped us book our 1 night stay at Huttons Hotel (said it was the only one available- he had a contract with the hotel) and said it was just outside the station, we payed less than the nightly rate and had 3 people in a room, but still felt that we payed TOO much.. once we stepped foot out of the station we must've seen approx. 20 budget hotels that were vacant.. halfway through the street, the name changes for about 2 blocks, and then changes back to what it was before.. plus all the hotels look the same so it gets pretty confusing and we got lost.. anyways ... the room was TINY! since we had 3 people, they just basically had a twin bed in addition to the double bed and there was barely any room to walk (besides the area infront of the bathroom and door) .. the bathroom was literally an airplane bathroom if not smaller. If your sitting on the toilet, one foot will probably be in the shower (and this is coming from someone that is 5'3, 125 lbs). The beds were not comfortable. We felt safe though because outside the window were pricks. The breakfast was okay.. and the man that worked at night was really nice and helped us in any way he could. Overall, I'd probably pick a place closer to Victoria station.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: PaulaNorwich_UK
Reviews.Content: Great location about 10 mins walk from Victoria station. Walking distance to Westminster, Hyde Park, Kensington. The room was a decent size for London and we got a really good price for a London hotel. The only downsides were that we were kept awake throughout the early hours of the morning with other guests coming back and stomping up the stairs and slamming doors on our floor, the floor below and the floor above which just resounded around the hotel. Full English breakfast was included in our rate but apparently that doesn't include bacon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: petermacn
Reviews.Content: The big plus with Huttons is it is reasonably priced. To get a hotel for four nights minutes from Westminster for two for Â£205 was excellent. The number 24 bus takes you into the city from outside the hotel and delivers you back to the door! The receptionists were helpful without being over friendly! They would go to some trouble to help with queries. The room itself was very small with a plastic ensuite jammed in the corner! Functional but not luxurious by any means. The room was kept clean however, with beds changed and room tidied every day. The one aspect which let it down was the breakfast room! It is like something you would see in an institution, bare and uninviting. The breakfast too was a bit miserable, wrinkly sausages, beans, lumpy egg and coffee from a machine. You had to be out of the breakfast room by 9.30 too or the waitressses made you feel you were overstaying your welcome! I would urge management to improve the breakfast and breakfast room. Otherwise a perfectly acceptable budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dacron
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience we have ever had. Having travelled the world and knowing not to expect much from such an expensive city like London, we did not have very high standards. But this was well below any expectations that we had. We arrived and were put in a room in the lower basement down 2 flights of stairs which had absolutely no natural light that smelt of mould and cigarrete smoke. We then asked to move and were put in a room one level higher in a room that was a little better. It had a common toilet outside that every morning at exactly 6am someone would come and smoke their cigarrete in with the smoke wafting straight into our room. The bathroom resembled an aeroplane toilet and was not clean at all. The heating in our room was not adequate at all so we requested a portable heater. To which we were not provided with as there were only 7 which were all in use. We spent that night particuarly cold and contemplated checking out if the situation was not ammended. The breakfast was satisfactory and the staff in the breakfast room were very friendly. With this negative review comes 2 positives. 1) All but one staff member at reception was incredibly helpful and friendly. 2) the location was perfect for seeing all the sights in London and access to Victoria Station was only 200m from the hotel. There are also many restaurants in the Belgravia area. There is also a Sainsbury's at the entrance of Victoria station, which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not for couples”
Reviews.Author: lukey_g81
Reviews.Content: Positives - Great transport links to Central London Good for one night stop overs if you are not too fussy Negatives - Not good atmosphere/rooms for couples/romance Rooms could do with being updated Could hear people above our room walking around Breakfast was terrible sausages, beans and scrambled egg. Cereal also available. Dining room more like a hostel dining room. Summary Do not expect your partner to feel like you've treated her/him if staying here

Reviews.Title: “Good for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: rikki009
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Huttons Hotel for three nights over the summer with my girlfriend on a city break. Huttons is located in a nice area near Victoria. The Hotel was easy to find just a 10 minute walk from Pimlico and Victoria tube stations. Check in was speedy with no problems and the staff seemed very pleasent. When we got to our room we were satisfied, as it was larger than most city hotels. The ensuite/shower room was quite small, but provided all the essentials for a city weekend. The breakfast room was in the basement which was undergoing some renovation at the time, however the breakfast buffet was good and had plenty of varity. Overall Huttons was a good choice for a city break and both myself and girlfriend would be happy to return here again.

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel, with small rooms and a little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mrc_uk2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel towards the end of November 2007 with my partner. On booking I was looking for a budget hotel with 3 stars and a suitable location to get to the centre of London with ease. On reading the write up on the website I thought I had found th ideal place. However on arriving at the hotel I was a little dissapointed with what greeted me. The room was tiny. A double room with just enough room to walk around the edge of the bed.
